clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between Patient Perception and Findings on Clinical Examination in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: CorRELation Between PatIent PErception of the Ability to Perform Morning Activities and Findings on Clinical Examination in COPD Patients Receiving Inhaled Combined Therapy (Corticosteroid/Long Acting ß2-agonist) - RELIEF Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, prospective, non-interventional study that aims to evaluate in daily clinical practice the possible correlation between patient perception of the ability to perform morning activities and the physician's assessment during a regular physical exam in patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), group C and D.

detailed_description.textblock: CorRELation between PatIent PErception of the Ability to Perform Morning Activities and Findings on Clinical Examination in COPD Patients receiving inhaled combined therapy (corticosteroid/long acting ß2-agonist) - RELIEF Study

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in CDLM (Capacity of Daily Living during the Morning) questionnaire.
Change from baseline of patient's general health status upon physical evaluation - visual scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Age (years), gender (male/female), weight (kg), height (cm), place of origin (urban/rural)
secondary_outcome.description: Descriptive statistics will be calculated for this outcome measure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of daily walking steps (by using pedometers)
Patient adherence to treatment (by using visual 5 point scale)
Number of unscheduled visit (exacerbations, emergency visits)

study_pop.textblock: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) patients group C and D

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), group C and D according to GOLD Guidelines, 2011
- Receive inhaled combined therapy for COPD (inhaled corticosteroid / long acting ß2-agonist); this treatment should have been initiated for at least one month before entering the study
- Current or past smokers, of at least 10 pack years
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of exacerbation of COPD symptoms within the last month before visit 1, inclusive.
- History of asthma or allergic rhinitis.
- History of lung carcinoma or any other respiratory condition that may limit the airflow circulation.
